subject: p16751749
History: A-year-old man with right chest tube, intubated, question interval change.
Impression: AP chest compared to and : Large area of consolidation at the right lung base either pneumonia or blood aspiration has not improved appreciably since. The somewhat smaller region of presumed pulmonary hemorrhage in the axillary region of the left mid lung has remained stable. Emphysema is responsible for severe hyperinflation. If there is any left pneumothorax it is medial, and unchanged. Solitary right pleural tube traverses a sleeve-like opacity that is probably a hematoma. There is no appreciable right pleural effusion. The heart size is normal. ET tube and left subclavian line are in standard placements and a nasogastric tube passes below the diaphragm and out of view.
